reviews.text: We chose this property when we contacted Mohegan for a room on a Monday night because we were seeing a concert at the arena. They were sold out on property, but booked us at the Hyatt at their partner rate.
reviews.title: New/Modern Property Convenient to Mohegan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This new Hyatt property was convenient to Mohegan, about a two minute drive before the entrance to the Mohegan main entrance (from there, another couple to navigate the myriad of garage/valet choices). There was probably even a better way to get to Mohegan than the way my GPS sent me, which was back on the highway - ask at the desk. There was a shuttle to the casino, but it ended at midnight and we were planning on staying late. I had also noticed there were quite a few concert goers checking in at the same time, and it was a pretty small shuttle.
reviews.title: Great hotel just a hop away from the Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I liked the room layout, which was living area with a sectional sofa (full pull out bed), desk & fridge and then partially separated bedroom with two queens. The bathroom had the separate sink/vanity area. As other reviewers have noted, the door to the bathroom was very large, so it made exiting the bathroom a bit awkward - design flaw I guess. The room was very clean and the bedding was comfortable.
reviews.title: Great choice if you don't want to pay high casino hotel rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a small snack bar in the lobby area that sold light snack fare, coffee and was also a bar open until 1AM. Most of the mid-range chain hotels seem to be going this direction (Courtyard, etc.) and I like it. It seemed to be fine, and there was a small, but by no means unreasonable bunch of folks in the lobby when we returned just after 12:30 and the hotel had some soft music playing. They hotel also offered complimentary continental breakfast, but I wasn't awake in time to try it.
reviews.title: Save your money for the tables, stay off property
New Hotel
reviews.text: There was a nice big flat panel tv, and if you are technically inclined, you can hook up your laptop to the tv. Which leads me to my pet peeve - particularly since this is a newer hotel. In a hotel this modern, one that actually encourages technology with an ipod dock in-room and the ability to hook a laptop up to the television, and in this age of ipods, kindles, ipads, etc, there was no in=room safe. I looked all over the room and I couldn't find it. So if there was one - it was well hidden and I apologize, but I couldn't find it anywhere.

reviews.title: Service to be desired....
reviews.text: Here is a copy of my Hyatt Questionaire:

I travel FULL time for my job. I am Marriott Silver and Hilton Gold, therefore, most of my hotel stays are with them. Over the past couple of years I accured enough points for a comp room (value 399.00) at the Hyatt Uncasville. I was taking my daughers to a concert and wanted to stay overnight.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel! What great staff and service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I arrived at 2:00 PM and was promptly told (without looking), "there are no rooms, and I expect none to be ready until 4:00". I said very politely, "could you please start a list and call me when the first one is available?" I was told "Certainly"... I gave me phone number.
reviews.title: Top Shelf!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went on to expain that I realized check in was 4:00, but certainly some rooms were cleaned between 11 (check out) and 2? I was told, "The rooms are all cleaned, then housekeeping supervisors have to check all the rooms and then the GM checks them". Humm, odd system, when you are turning away your loyalty customers and you admit to having clean rooms. When I returned within the hour, SEVERAL folks were checking in and recieving keys..Obvious;y, the promise had been broken...When I finally went up to the desk, I was told by the same girl, "Sorry I never called you, I was so busy checking people in"....Hummm I am certain she saw me within the past 30 minutes sitting in front of the check in desk....
reviews.title: More than the casino hotel could offer at half the price!

reviews.text: Leaves one feeling "less" than special for her first Hyatt award night....BTW...I asked to a late check out and was locked out of my room at 11 (eventhough the front desk said noon would work)...I spent the entire hour trying to get back in the room, housekeeping would not let me in........I had to take my cold and wet kids to the lobby and wait in a long line to reactivate the key...YIKES :(
reviews.title: Save money and stay here !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Weekend prices at Mohegan can get REALLY steep, and the hotel is often sold out due to conferences, performances, and bachelor/bachelorette parties. On a sold out weekend, my husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Place instead, and it far exceeded my expectations. It is clean, modern, affordable, and super convenient to get to and from the casino. The free shuttle runs frequently, and is maybe 5 minutes door to door from the hotel to the casino. The rooms are quite large and tastefully decorated, with a great separate sitting/living area.
reviews.title: A great, affordable alternative to staying at the casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My one complaint was the breakfast. The area gets very crowded, and the staff kept putting away the free continental items early, well before the designated breakfast time was over. People ended up having to order off the non-free menu instead, because the free stuff was all gone. I heard one group complain and saw that the managers agreed to comp the food they were forced to buy, but no such offer was extended to me and others who were in the same predicament.
reviews.title: New, clean, and convenient to Mohegan Sun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While it's of course not quite as convenient as staying at the casino itself, the Hyatt Place is overall a great and affordable alternative. You won't find a better option in the area.
reviews.title: Always a lovely stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed with my wife in March 2011, hotel staff was very helpful and our room was ready right away. Very clean and new hotel, they offer breakfast in the morning which was much better than we expected. Free shuttle to Mohegan Sun that ran often enough that you didnt have to wait long for the next one. Overall a good experience, would stay here again if going to the Uncasville area.
reviews.title: Surprisingly Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the 2nd time I've stayed here and I would certainly stay again. While they do authorize $50/night for incidentals on your credit card (a shock as I work at a hotel and we only authorize $25/night), the check-in process was fast and Alex was incredibly informative and warming.
reviews.title: A Pleasant Surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After deciding that a trip the Connecticut casinos was in order, and not wanting to pay the exorbitant prices at Mohegan Sun, I did a little research and found the Hyatt Place. Located only a few minutes from Mohegan Sun, the hotel was in a prime location for entertaining ourselves there the next day. Also, since the prices were very reasonable, we decided to book a night's stay.
reviews.title: Many great things, but to me an awkward room layout.

reviews.text: Coming off the highway, it was a little bit of a challenge to find the place, however a huge billboard near the access road helped considerably. This hotel is situated down this access road, which, although the road was fine, the area did not seem to be fully constructed as it looked like buildings were still being built and the surrounding land was torn up and rocky. Upon seeing this, we had no idea what to expect from the hotel. However, once you drive to the end of the road, the outside of the hotel looks fine and the parking lot well lit and paved.
reviews.title: great option if the price of a casino hotel room is a little out of your league...

reviews.text: Upon entering, there is a smallish lobby, with an open front desk, and hallways leading either to their kitchen, where pizza and sandwiches were served, and the other leading to the elevators. Check in was swift, and the staff was cordial, offering a tour of the hotel which we politely declined.
reviews.title: easy to get to Mohegan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before we got to the room, we decided to explore a little bit. The pool and fitness room were clean and well lit, and looked inviting. Being in the evening, the were also empty. We did not make use of these areas, as it was fairly late, but upon a return stay, I did not see anything there that would prevent us from giving them a try.
reviews.title: More than met our expectations and needs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was very spacious and highly clean, though I must admit I was a bit puzzled by the layout. The was a sitting area with a nice sectional, and the bed area next to each other, divided by a partial partition. A nice tv/media area was on the wall situated opposite the partition, visible if you were either on the couch, or in bed. However, considering the positioning, you would either halft to look at a right angle from the couch or a left angle from the bed. The bathroom was tucked away in a corner offshooting the bed area, and though on the small side, was very clean and with good water pressure in the shower. The only thing I did not like was the fact that the door opened into the bathroom, right in front of the toilet. It was fine when the door was closed, but walking in was a squeeze.
reviews.title: Could not be happier!!
